thread.title: Bye week 'very critical' for freshman defensive end Byron Cowart
thread.title_full: Bye week 'very critical' for Auburn freshman defensive end Byron Cowart | AL.com

author: James Crepea | jcrepea@al.com
title: Bye week 'very critical' for freshman defensive end Byron Cowart
text:
Byron Cowart has not contributed a lot statistically but the Auburn coaching staff is pleased with what the true freshman has done in his first five college games.
Auburn coach Gus Malzahn said Cowart has improved since arriving on campus over the summer and the bye week will be important for the rest of his season.
"I think this week will be very critical for him," Malzahn said, "and not just him, but the rest of our young guys."
Malzahn cited the improvements in production by true freshmen following the bye week in 2013, when Carl Lawson notched all four of his sacks during the final 10 games, as what he believes Cowart will do as his playing time increases.
RELATED: How will Auburn manage the hype surrounding Byron Cowart?
Defensive coordinator Will Muschamp said Cowart is "contributing" in his over 20 snaps per game.
"I've been very pleased with where he is and what he's doing," Muschamp said. "He made a nice penetration (against San Jose State), a big down for us right there to get them in a negative down and distance, forced a punt (later on the drive)."
The top-rated recruit in the country last season, Cowart has just four tackles, all assists, and two hurries so far. Cowart, who did not record a tackle against San Jose State, has not spoken publicly since arriving on campus and recently deleted his Twitter account.
RELATED: Gus Malzahn addresses Byron Cowart's tweets
Muschamp said there is a challenge in getting freshmen to understand they can play well without making their presence immediately felt in the box score. "It's the instant coffee society," Muschamp said. "Add water, put it in the microwave for 30 minutes and it's all going to work. That's really not the way it is all the time.
"He is playing at defensive line in the Southeastern Conference at a high level and will continue to improve and continue to get better, just like every other freshman I've ever coached that played as a freshman in the Southeastern Conference. There's been a bunch and he certainly is going to be a guy who is going to play at a high level."
Auburn defensive coordinator Will Muschamp: Oct. 7, 2015 Auburn defensive coordinator Will Muschamp talks to the media after practice Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, in Auburn, Ala. (Julie Bennett/jbennett@al.com)
